node.title: Sam Kerr dominates as Chelsea rout Champions League rivals 7-0
node.alt: Sam Kerr, wearing blue football kit, appears in mid-flip, with her legs bent, arms by her side, upside down
node.description: Matildas captain Sam Kerr has a hand in four of Chelsea's seven goals as they ease past Swiss side Servette in Champions League action overnight.
node.content: ["Sam Kerr is in red-hot form ahead of the Matildas'\u00a0friendly series against the USA this month, scoring twice and assisting two more as her Chelsea side demolished Swiss club Servette\u00a0in the Champions League overnight.", "Kerr's first major involvement came in the 15th minute through a cheeky back-heel assist for strike partner Fran Kirby to put the Blues 2-0 ahead following Melanie Leupolz's opener.", "She then netted twice herself in the space of three minutes to make it 4-0. Two more goals to Kirby and Tokyo Olympic gold medallist Jessie Fleming saw Chelsea go into half-time 6-0 in the lead. Kerr's final assist came just after the break as Norway's Guro Reiten made it seven.", "It was a baptism of fire for the Swiss champions,\u00a0now\u00a0home to Australian\u00a0full-back Tessa Tamplin, formerly of the Newcastle Jets.", "Servette currently\u00a0sit last in Group A, having conceded 15 goals and scored zero\u00a0after three matches.", "They will face Chelsea again in nine days' time before rematches against former winners Wolfsburg and Italian champions Juventus in December.", "Chelsea, meanwhile, are flying in the Champions League,\u00a0sitting first in Group A with two wins and a draw, scoring twelve and conceding four.", "Domestically, the Blues sit second\u00a0in England's Women's Super League, three points behind\u00a0Arsenal, home to Matildas Steph Catley, Caitlin Foord, and Lydia Williams, and two points ahead of Kyah Simon's Tottenham.", "Elsewhere in the Champions League\u00a0overnight, Juventus \u2014\u00a0now led by Aussie coach Joe Montemurro \u2014\u00a0drew 2-2 with Wolfsburg after a last-gasp equaliser in stoppage time from striker Cristiana Girelli.", "In Group B, French champions PSG defeated Real Madrid 4-0, while Ukranian side Zhytlobud-1 drew 0-0 with Iceland's Breidablik.", "Groups C and D kick off their matches in the early hours of Thursday morning. Reigning champions Barcelona will\u00a0take on Hoffenheim, Arsenal face Denmark's HB\u00a0K\u00f8ge,\u00a0Benfica play Swedish champions BK\u00a0H\u00e4cken \u2014\u00a0home to Australian midfielder Dylan Holmes \u2014 while\u00a0Ellie Carpenter's Lyon will clash with German giants Bayern Munich."]
